Hello Paul,

How are you submitting jobs?

I would create the job with http post, then upload the job config with http put, e.g.

$ curl -v -d "createpath=myjob&action=create" -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location -H "Accept: application/xml" https://localhost:8443/engine
$ curl -v -T my-crawler-beans.cxml -k -u admin:admin --anyauth --location https://localhost:8443/engine/job/myjob/jobdir/crawler-beans.cxml

See https://webarchive.jira.com/wiki/display/Heritrix/Heritrix+3.x+API+Guide

Noah


On 2012-07-23 14:42 , paul.ihde wrote:
> Hi,
>
> I'm using the Heritrix 3.1 REST API to create/launch/etc. jobs via a http client.
> Recently I ran into a rather weird behavior : all my submited jobs appear in the heritrix "jobs" folder as plain xml files (one xml file per job):
> * job1-beans.xml
> * job2-beans.xml
> ...
>
> instead of folders (one folder per job) :
> * job1
> * job2
> * etc.
>
> I'm curious if anyone ran into this kind of issue before and if you guys have any suggestions on how to solve this issue.
>
> Regards
> Paul.
